roleset.name: (restricting one's) food intake

role.descr: distinguishing characteristic of the diet (ultimately indicates food consumed or avoided)

roles.note: If it starts to seem too much like it's referring to food itself, rather than the act of eating in a certain way, call it .YY.

example.text: Both Drs. Meade and Grokest prescribed medications for him to take, and instructed him to watch his diet (to lower his cholesterol),
example.note: This could be viewed as a non-event if you think of 'diet' as 'the list of foods you eat'. But it might also be rephrased as 'to watch his eating', which would be an event. So go ahead and tag if you can construe it eventively.

example.name: light verb, both args
example.text: So I'm prepping myself *pro* to do a green diet soon.
example.note: A green diet is a very specific diet, so saying 'green' tells what foods can and cannot be consumed.

example.name: Light Verb
example.text: This is how-1 *PRO*-2 to do a diet that has minimal exercise *-1.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on WN eventive noun lexicon (4th sense). No VNcls.
